info.description:
## TMF API Reference: TMF 678 - Customer bill Management

The Customer Bill Management API allows to find and retrieve one or several customer bills (also called invoices) produced for a customer. A customer bill is an electronic or paper document produced at the end of the billing process. The customer bill gathers and displays different items (applied customer billing rates generated during the rating and billing processes) to be charged to a customer. It represents a total amount due for all the products during the billing period and all significant information like dates, bill reference...
This API provides also operations to find and retrieve the details of applied customer billing rates presented on a customer bill. 
Finally, this API allows to request in real-time a customer bill creation and to manage this request.

### Resources 
- customerBill
- billSummary
- billItem

### Operations
Customer Bill Management API performs the following operations :
- Retrieve a customer bill or a collection of customer bills depending on filter criteria.
- Retrieve customer bill summary depending on filter criteria.
- Retrieve customer bill item or collection of customer bill items depending on filter criteria.
### billSummary
This provides the list of bill summary for each billable services along with account level charges. In order to differentiate the distinct BillSummary types, we will use the linked LogicalResource entity, in concrete the category parameter (BillSummary.LogicalResource.category), with the following LOV:
- MSISDN
- FLN
- BB
- Marketplace
- Account

appliedPayment.description: Applied payment is a payment associated with the bill. There may be a partial payment, then there should be several applied payments available. On the other hand, more than one bill could be payed by one payment. In general there is an n:m relation between payment and bill.

billCycle.description: On cycle bills are produced in a defined billing cycle, e.g. 'billcycle March 2020' This bill cycle is referenced here to define the different dates connected to a bill.

billDate.description: Bill date, external customer view (in consequence: different to the production date of the bill).

billDocument.description: This array attribute allows to attach several documents to a bill. Some examples could be: PDF documents of the bill, work orders, structured versions of the bill in other formats like EDIFACT ... The intention of this attribute is, to attach documents with almost no need for change but with interest for the human users of the bill resource. The RefOrValue schema is choosen here to support a handy patch of the bill (add a new attachment by value) and to give a regular reference in case of a GET request.

billNo.description: Bill reference known by the customer or the party and displayed on the bill. Could be different from the id and can be defined by business rules (e.g. rules of a tax authority)

billingAccount.description: The bill is issued to a party (person/customer/...). This party is resolved by using this billing account.

billingPeriod.description: The on cycle bills cover a regular billing period, e.g. from the first day of a month to the last day. For off cycle bills this attribute could be empty or defined by specific business rules.

category.description: Category of the bill produced : normal, duplicate, interim, last, trial customer or credit note for example

id.description: Unique identifier of he bill

nextBillDate.description: ). Approximate date of  the next bill production given for information (only used/meaningful for on cycle / regular bills)

paymentDueDate.description: Date at which the amount due should have been paid

paymentMethod.description: paymentMethod here is recognized to be not really necessary in a STANDARD. It could be obtained by a GET request on the billing account. Conclusion: paymentMethod is marked to DEPRECIATED and will be removed in one of the next versions.

relatedParty.description: Any party with relevance for this bill could be referenced here. Business needs of the CSPs / API operators define when and how the attribute 'relatedParty' has to be used.

remainingAmount.description: The remainingAmount is informative for human readers. It's value has to be defined by business needs. Possible algorithms are: Updated with every payment, updated only once with the first payment, ...  To get the exact validated values to a certain given date, a recalculation based on the payments could be performed.

runType.description: onCycle (a bill can be created as a result of a cycle run) or offCycle (a bill can be created as a result of other events such as customer request or account close)

state.description: Status of the bill according to the predefined states in the enumeration 'customerBillStateType' (new, onhold, validated, sent settled, partiallyPaid)

CustomerBill.title: CustomerBill
CustomerBill.description: The customer bill. Can be a regular recurring bill or an extra bill on demand by the customer or the CSP. (For bills on demand please refer to 'CustomerBillOnDemand' in this document.
